faq_en.title: ğŸ¤” Does acupuncture hurt?
faq_en.payload: Most people feel little or no pain. You may notice a brief, mild sensation when the sterile, single-use needle is inserted.

faq_en.title: ğŸ›¡ï¸ Is acupuncture safe?
faq_en.payload: Yes â€” when performed by a licensed practitioner. We use sterile, single-use, disposable needles and follow strict hygiene protocols.

faq_en.title: ğŸ“† How many sessions will I need?
faq_en.payload: It depends on your condition, severity, and how your body responds. Some feel relief after one session; others may need a series. Your acupuncturist will create a personalized plan.

faq_en.title: ğŸ“ What should I do before my appointment?
faq_en.payload: Eat a light meal, wear loose clothing, and arrive a few minutes early so you can relax before treatment.

faq_en.title: â±ï¸ How long is a typical session?
faq_en.payload: The first visit usually lasts 45â€“60 minutes, including consultation and treatment. Follow-up visits are typically 30â€“45 minutes.

faq_en.title: ğŸ’³ Can I use my insurance?
faq_en.payload: Many insurance plans cover acupuncture for certain conditions. We can help verify your coverage and explain your benefits before your first appointment.

faq_en.title: âš ï¸ Are there any side effects?
faq_en.payload: Minor bruising, light bleeding, or temporary soreness at a needle site can happen but usually resolve quickly.

faq_en.title: â• Can I combine acupuncture with other treatments or medications?
faq_en.payload: Yes â€” acupuncture is often used alongside conventional medicine, physical therapy, or chiropractic care. Please inform your acupuncturist about any treatments or medications youâ€™re taking.

faq_en.title: ğŸ˜Œ What if Iâ€™m afraid of needles?
faq_en.payload: Our practitioners are gentle and explain each step. Many people who were nervous at first end up finding sessions relaxing.
